metadata.Title: CVE-2017-6259 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
NVIDIA GPU Display Driver contains a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer handler where an incorrect detection and recovery from an invalid state produced by specific user actions may lead to denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-6259` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libcuda1-367 - 384.90-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libcuda1-375 - 384.90-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
nvidia-367 - 384.90-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
nvidia-375 - 384.90-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
nvidia-libopencl1-367 - 384.90-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
nvidia-libopencl1-375 - 384.90-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
nvidia-opencl-icd-367 - 384.90-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
nvidia-opencl-icd-375 - 384.90-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

libcuda1-375 - 384.90-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
